description: MAISEN is the first web agent to combine advantages of automatic and manual genome annotation. MAISEN lets you browse results of many functional annotation programs in one place.
name: MAISEN

metadata.abstract: © 2021, Springer Science+Business Media, LLC, part of Springer Nature.Over the last 15 years, the costs of DNA sequencing have sharply fallen, effectively shifting the costs of DNA analysis from sequencing to bioinformatic curation and storage. A huge number of available DNA sequences (including genomes and metagenomes) resulted in the development of various agents for sequence annotation. While much effort has been invested into the development of automatic annotation pipelines, manual curation of their results is still necessary in order to obtain a reliable and strictly validated data. Unfortunately, due to its time-consuming nature, manual annotation is now rarely used. In this chapter, a protocol for efficient manual annotation of prokaryotic DNA sequences using a novel bioinformatic agent—MAISEN (http://maisen.ddlemb.com ), is presented. MAISEN is a free, web-based agent designed to accelerate manual annotation, by providing the user with simple interface and precomputed alignments for each predicted feature. It was designed to be available for every scientist, regardless of their bioinformatic proficiency.
metadata.title: Simple, Reliable, and Time-Efficient Manual Annotation of Bacterial Genomes with MAISEN
